text: Tom Brady knows a thing or two about
leading teammates to Greatness for a
recent hbr article I had the incredible
opportunity to work with the football
legend as he reflected on his career
when we talk about success we often
focus on individual achievements but
true leaders know that nothing
significant is ever achieved alone it's
all about the team Tom and I identified
seven key behaviors for great team
leadership first put the team first even
when facing personal setbacks always
prioritize the team success two
appreciate the unsung heroes recognize
and value those who work behind the
scenes three you set the standard create
a culture where everyone gives 100%
effort four understand individual
motivations know what drives each team
member and use that to inspire them five
complement the formal leader balance
your own leadership style with that of
your coach or manager collaborate with
other teammates who can also play comp
mentary leadership roles six counteract
selfish behavior be aware of the
external pressures that can lead to
self-centered actions and always
reinforce the team first mentality seven
connect outside the office build
relationships and Trust through shared
experiences Beyond work leadership is
about caring deeply for your teammates
and the collective goal of winning it's
about trust passion and creating an
environment where everyone feels valued
and motivated to give their best
